items.title: Trump Official Warns California Against Arresting Federal Agents
items.summary: Deputy U.S. Attorney General Todd Blanche told top California leaders that they would be prosecuted if they arrested federal agents performing immigration raids.

items.title: Federal Workers Have Started Missing Paychecks During the Shutdown
items.summary: Thousands missed their first paychecks this week, with no end in sight to the government shutdown that began on Oct. 1.

items.title: Letitia James to Appear in Court as Battle Over Trump-Urged Prosecution Begins
items.summary: The New York attorney general, indicted by President Trump’s handpicked prosecutor in the Eastern District of Virginia, is expected to plead not guilty in her arraignment on Friday.

items.title: How San Francisco Mayor Daniel Lurie Avoided Trump’s Enforcement Surge
items.summary: Daniel Lurie, the San Francisco mayor, relied on powerful tech executives and his own low-key approach to help his liberal city escape a rush of federal agents.

items.title: How Does the U.S. Decide Which Boats to Target? Here’s What We Know.
items.summary: Officials say intercepted communications are the core of the intelligence collected on the boats.

items.title: The Peril of a White House That Flaunts Its Indifference to the Law
items.summary: The White House has made no legal argument explaining its bald claim that the president has wartime power to summarily kill people suspected of smuggling drugs.

items.title: Trump accuses Canada of attempting to influence US supreme court with anti-tariff advertising campaign – live
items.summary: <p>The US president announced he ended talks in retaliation to an ad featuring Ronald Reagan speaking negatively about tariffs</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/oct/24/trump-says-all-canada-trade-talks-terminated-over-ad-criticising-tariffs">Trump says all Canada trade talks ‘terminated’ over ad criticizing tariffs</a></p></li></ul><p><strong>The US secretary of state has confirmed Donald Trump’s announcement that all trade negotiations with Canada have been suspended.</strong></p><p>Marco Rubio spoke during a visit to a civil-military coordination centre in southern Israel.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/24/donald-trump-trade-negotiations-canada-mark-carney-terminated-tariff-letitia-james-new-york-us-politics-live-news">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: First Thing: Trump backs down on sending federal troops to San Francisco
items.summary: <p>Protesters flood streets in show of resistance. Plus, our architecture critic on Trump’s bulletproof ballroom bling</p><p>Good morning.</p><p>Donald Trump has <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/23/san-francisco-federal-immigration-operation">canceled plans for a deployment of federal troops to San Francisco</a> that had sparked widespread condemnation from California leaders and sent protesters flooding into the streets.</p><p><strong>What did Trump say about his change of mind?</strong> Trump confirmed he had a conversation with mayor, Daniel Lurie, writing on social media: “I spoke to Mayor Lurie last night and he asked, very nicely, that I give him a chance to see if he can turn it around.”</p><p><strong>What are current tariffs on goods from Canada?</strong> Washington originally <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/apr/03/canada-trump-tariffs-exemption">imposed a 25% tariff</a> on imports of goods including timber, steel, aluminum and cars in the spring, prompting retaliatory action from Ottawa. The rate was <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/jul/31/trump-canada-tariffs-order">raised to 35% by Trump</a> in August.</p><p><strong>How did Carney respond to Trump’s fusillade?</strong> His office didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment last night. The prime minister was set to leave on Friday morning for a summit in Asia, while Trump is set to do the same on Friday evening.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/24/first-thing-trump-backs-down-on-sending-federal-troops-to-san-francisco">Continue reading...</a>
